data.chText: 片刻；瞬间
data.enText: a very short period of time

data.chText: 请您稍等一下，好吗？
data.enText: Could you wait a moment , please?

data.chText: 请稍候！
data.enText: One moment, please (= Please wait a short time) .

data.chText: 他想了一下才回答。
data.enText: He thought for a moment before replying.

data.chText: 我一会儿就回来。
data.enText: I'll be back in a moment .

data.chText: 我们到得一点也不早。
data.enText: We arrived not a moment too soon (= almost too late) .

data.chText: 过了一会儿，我听到一声可怕的撞击声。
data.enText: Moments later (= a very short time later) , I heard a terrible crash.

data.chText: 准确时刻；正是时候
data.enText: an exact point in time

data.chText: 我们这会儿很忙。
data.enText: We're busy at the moment (= now) .

data.chText: 我一时心软就答应了。
data.enText: I agreed in a moment of weakness.

data.chText: 就在那时，电话铃响了。
data.enText: At that very moment , the phone rang.

data.chText: 从那时候开始，她就再也没真正好受过。
data.enText: From that moment on , she never felt really well again.

data.chText: 时机；机遇；时光；做某事的时刻
data.enText: a particular occasion; a time for doing sth

data.chText: 我得找个适当的时机告诉他这个坏消息。
data.enText: I'm waiting for the right moment to tell him the bad news.

data.chText: 那是我一生中最快乐的一段时光。
data.enText: That was one of the happiest moments of my life.

data.chText: 我是不是来得不是时候？
data.enText: Have I caught you at a bad moment?
(at) any moment (now)

data.chText: 很快；随时
data.enText: very soon

data.chText: 快点！他随时都会回来。
data.enText: Hurry up! He'll be back any moment now.
at this moment in time

data.chText: 现在；此时此刻
data.enText: now, at the present time

data.chText: 此时此刻，我不知道自己会作出什么决定。
data.enText: At this moment in time, I don't know what my decision will be.
for the moment/present

data.chText: 目前；暂时
data.enText: for now; for a short time

data.chText: 这房子现在还够大。要是有了孩子，我们得搬。
data.enText: This house is big enough for the moment, but we'll have to move if we have children.
have its/your moments

data.chText: 有短暂的好时候
data.enText: to have short times that are better, more interesting, etc. than others

data.chText: 这工作并不总是很带劲，但也有让人兴奋的时候。
data.enText: The job isn't exciting all the time, but it has its moments.
the moment of truth

data.chText: 考验的时刻；（决策的）关键时刻
data.enText: a time when sb/sth is tested, or when important decisions are made
the moment (that)…

data.chText: 一…就…
data.enText: as soon as…

data.chText: 希望他一到我就见到他。
data.enText: I want to see him the moment he arrives.
not for a/one moment

data.chText: 当然不；一点也不
data.enText: certainly not; not at all

data.chText: 我觉得她一定不会接受的，不过你可以去问问她。
data.enText: I don't think for a moment that she'll accept but you can ask her.
of moment

data.chText: 非常重要
data.enText: very important

data.chText: 极其重要的事
data.enText: matters of great moment
of the moment

data.chText: 红极一时；盛行一时；广为谈论

before.enText: of a person, a job, an issue, etc.

data.enText: famous, important and talked about a lot now

data.chText: 她是当前最红的时装设计师。
data.enText: She's the fashion designer of the moment.
just a minute/moment/second

data.chText: 稍等一会儿；请稍候
data.enText: used to ask sb to wait for a short time

data.chText: “我可以见伯恩斯先生吗？”“请稍等一会儿，我来查一下。”
data.enText: ‘Is Mr Burns available?’ ‘Just a second, please, I'll check.’
the last minute/moment

data.chText: （重大事情前的）最后一刻，紧要关头
data.enText: the latest possible time before an important event

data.chText: 事到临头他们却改变了计划。
data.enText: They changed the plans at the last minute.

data.chText: 别等到最后一刻才来作决定。
data.enText: Don't leave your decision to the last moment.
at short notice
at a moment's notice

data.chText: 随时；一经通知立即；没有准备时间
data.enText: not long in advance; without warning or time for preparation

data.chText: 这是我们临时能弄到的最好的房间了。
data.enText: This was the best room we could get at such short notice.

data.chText: 你必须随时准备出发。
data.enText: You must be ready to leave at a moment's notice.
the psychological moment

data.chText: 最佳时机；最适当时机
data.enText: the best time to do sth in order for it to be successful
on the spur of the moment

data.chText: 一时冲动之下；心血来潮
data.enText: suddenly, without planning in advance

data.chText: 我一时心动，给他打了电话。
data.enText: I phoned him up on the spur of the moment.

data.chText: 心血来潮的决定
data.enText: a spur-of-the-moment decision
wait a minute/moment/second

data.chText: 等一会儿；稍等一下
data.enText: to wait for a short time

data.chText: 你能等一会儿让我打个电话吗？
data.enText: Can you wait a second while I make a call?

data.chText: （刚注意到、想起某事或突然有了个主意）且慢，等一等
data.enText: used when you have just noticed or remembered sth, or had a sudden idea

data.chText: 等一等，不是这把钥匙。
data.enText: Wait a minute─this isn't the right key.

ex.chText: 请别挂断电话！她马上回来。
ex.enText: Please hold on! She will be back in an instant.

ex.chText: 我一看见他便认出他就是那个曾经帮我搬过箱子的警察。
ex.enText: The instant I saw him, I knew he was the policeman who had helped me carry the box.

synonyms.bx: 指极短的时间，如转瞬即逝的刹那间，通常用单数。

ex.chText: 你能抽点时间填写这个问卷调查吗？
ex.enText: Can you spare a few moments to fill out this questionnaire?
He will come back to see you in a moment.

synonyms.bx: 指很短的一段时间，多用于日常口语。

ex.chText: 别担心，他一会儿就回来。
ex.enText: Don't worry, and he'll be back in a second/moment.

ex.chText: 稍等片刻，那名记者马上会过来采访你。
ex.enText: Just a second/moment, the reporter will come to interview you.

synonyms.bx: 指极为短暂的一段时间，常可与 moment 换用。

example: decisions of great consequence are made by the president himself
virtue is of more moment than security
that result is of no consequence

tr: the n-th moment of a distribution is the expected value of the n-th power of the deviations from a fixed value
a turning force produced by an object acting at a distance (or a measure of that force)

example: the disappointments of the here and now
she is studying at the moment
the moment he arrived the party began

value.def: You can refer to a very short period of time, for example a few seconds, as a moment or moments .

example.ex: In a moment he was gone...
example.tran: 一转眼他就不见了。

example.ex: She stared at him a moment, then turned away...
example.tran: 她凝视他片刻，然后转过脸去。

example.ex: Stop for one moment and think about it!...
example.tran: 稍停片刻，想一想！

example.ex: In moments, I was asleep once  more.
example.tran: 不一会儿工夫，我又睡着了。

value.def: A particular moment is the point in time at which something happens.

example.ex: At this moment a car stopped at the house...
example.tran: 就在这时，一辆轿车在房前停下了。

example.ex: Many people still remember the moment when they heard that President Kennedy had been assassinated.
example.tran: 很多人仍然记得听到肯尼迪总统遇刺的那一刻。

example.ex: ...a decision that may have been made in a moment of panic.
example.tran: 或许是在惊慌失措时作出的决定

value.def: If you say that something will or may happen at any moment or any moment now, you are emphasizing that it is likely to happen very soon.

example.ex: They ran the risk of being shot at any moment...
example.tran: 他们冒着随时会中弹的危险。

example.ex: He'll be here to see you any moment now.
example.tran: 他马上就会来这儿看你。

value.def: You use expressions such as at the moment ,at this moment, and at the present moment to indicate that a particular situation exists at the time when you are speaking.

example.ex: At the moment, no one is talking to me...
example.tran: 此刻没人跟我说话。

example.ex: This is being planned at the present moment...
example.tran: 目前这件事正在计划中。

example.ex: He's touring South America at this moment in time.
example.tran: 他此刻正在南美旅游观光。

value.def: If you say that you do not believe for a moment or for one moment that something is true, you are emphasizing that you do not believe that it could possibly be true.

example.ex: I don't for a moment think there'll be a divorce.
example.tran: 我从来没想过将来会离婚。

value.def: You use for the moment to indicate that something is true now, even if it will not be true in the future.

example.ex: For the moment, however, the government is happy to live with it.
example.tran: 不过目前政府对此还乐于容忍。

value.def: If you say that someone or something has their moments, you are indicating that there are times when they are successful or interesting, but that this does not happen very often.

example.ex: The film has its moments...
example.tran: 这部电影有其吸引人之处。

example.ex: He's not the thoroughly outgoing character you'd predict, although he has his moments.
example.tran: 虽然他也有活泼的时候，但他并非如你所想的那么外向。

value.tran: 有成功(或得意)的时刻；有吸引人的时刻

value.def: If someone does something at the last moment, they do it at the latest time possible.

example.ex: They changed their minds at the last moment and refused to go.
example.tran: 他们在最后一刻改变主意，决定不去了。

value.def: You use the expression the next moment, or expressions such as 'one moment he was there, the next he was gone', to emphasize that something happens suddenly, especially when it is very different from what was happening before.

example.ex: The next moment there was an almighty crash...
example.tran: 接着发生了剧烈的撞击。

example.ex: He is unpredictable, weeping one moment, laughing the next.
example.tran: 他喜怒无常，一会儿哭，一会儿笑。

value.tran: 下一刻，一会儿，紧接着（尤指突然发生很大变化）

value.def: You use of the moment to describe someone or something that is or was especially popular at a particular time, especially when you want to suggest that their popularity is unlikely to last long or did not last long.

example.ex: He's the man of the moment, isn't he?
example.tran: 他现在很红，不是吗？

example.ex: He calls it a 'contraption', using his favourite word of the moment.
example.tran: 他用了眼下他最喜欢说的“玩意儿”一词来称呼它。

value.def: If you say that something happens the moment something else happens, you are emphasizing that it happens immediately after the other thing.

example.ex: The moment I closed my eyes, I fell asleep.
example.tran: 我闭上眼睛就睡着了。

trans: 在那时；就在那一刻；在那一瞬间
